job_title: Senior Paramedic in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: pay, benefits, equipment, 911 calls, education is decent, and the experience gained is priceless.
cons: schedule isn't great, supervision needs a serious overhaul, and dispatch is often useless.

pros: Equipment is excellent, new and well maintained. County protocols allow for autonomy, and produce very well trained medics.  Participates in study's and makes changes accordingly. MICU and Community Paramedic program in place. Medics are held to a high standard and are expected to provide exceptional patient care.
cons: Shifts are not accommodating to family life. Benefits are terrible. Time off is half of what other companies provide. Employee retention is not a priority.  Employee wellness is not a concern of management.

pros: Best EMS service in Michigan.  Best pay and benefits in the industry (I've searched around) and the nicest equipment which is vital in this line of work.  Rescue and transfer calls so we aren't doing the same types of calls over and over.  Has been in business for over 35 years.
cons: You will work hard if you are an employee here.  We run a lot of calls, both rescue and transfers.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: I've worked in billing for some years now and love it here - the dept is like a closely-knit family, the turnover is small, and the management of our department is super. Kind and thoughtful and supportive. I would recommend it without reservation. Best are the perks including some compensation for external education, medical and dental, and a fine HSA.
cons: The work itself is very routine and predictable - but if you like that, it isn't particularly a disadvantage. And the job security offsets it.

pros: co-workers,road supervisors, newer equipment, pro-active with medical director
cons: high upper management needs to get on board with listening to the employees, instead of looking at numbers and statistics.  low pay, have to work many hours of overtime to make a above poverty living.

review_title: Wonderful place to work, great experience.
pros: High pay, decent health insurance, 403b, Generous Career Development Program (Tuition Reimbursement), PTO, STD, LTD, great coworkers, lots of overtime available.
cons: Sometimes over zealous management, not in touch with the needs of employees with families, frequent changes to important company information without asking input from effected employees.

review_title: Not the best, not the worst
pros: Wages were the best in the state, and the experience you get from the training program seemed top notch.
cons: Poor, undertrained management and higher ups not being receptive to what "boots on the ground" have to say.

pros: Have useful learning program for road staff members to learn protocol and routing
cons: Admin to road staff communications not clear
